intro: Berlinia grandiflora var. heudelotiana, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its thick, dark bark and dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, yellowish-white flowers arranged in panicles. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. This species is also noted for its ability to withstand drought and its role in traditional medicine.
